prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered end and a curved top edge. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0625, 0.0. Now we will create the 2D sketch on face 1. Draw a circle with a center at (0.0833, 0.0833) and a radius of 0.0833. Next, move to face 2. We will create two arcs and two lines to form a rectangle with a curved top edge. The first arc starts at (0.0, 0.0833), ends at (0.1667, 0.0833), and has a mid point at (0.0833, 0.1667). The second arc starts at (0.1667, 0.6667), ends at (0.0, 0.6667), and has a mid point at (0.0833, 0.5833). The two lines will connect the end points of the arcs. On face 3, draw another circle with a center at (0.0833, 0.6667) and a radius of 0.0833. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.0625 towards the normal. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and a translation vector of 0.0417, 0.0, 0.0417. Create the 2D sketch on face 1. Draw a circle with a center at (0.0417, 0.0417) and a radius of 0.0417. Similarly, create the 2D sketch on face 2. Draw another circle with a center at (0.0417, 0.625) and a radius of 0.0417. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.6667. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.1042 opposite to the normal. The boolean operation to be used here is 'cut'. The final shape is a rectangular metal bar with a hole on one end, obtained by combining the two parts. Part 1 forms the rectangular bar and part 2 forms the hole in the bar. Adjust the dimensions and shapes as per the requirements.</description>
